subject: Management
title: Groupthink
description: A micro-lesson that makes Groupthink usable.

hook.text: NASA engineers had doubts about the Challenger launch. Nobody spoke up. Seven people died.

buildup.text: Groupthink happens when the desire for harmony overrides honest critical thinking.

discovery.text: Irving Janis identified it: groups suppress dissent to maintain cohesion, especially under pressure.

twist.text: The more stressed the group, the more they crave agreement. Disagreement feels like betrayal.

climax.text: Assign someone to play devil's advocate. Make dissent a formal, expected role.

punchline.text: Agreement feels safe. It's often the most dangerous thing in the room.

quiz.question: What causes groupthink?
options: The desire for harmony suppresses honest critical thinking
Too many conflicting opinions slow down decisions
Leaders who encourage open debate in every meeting
